sect1.title: Website Changes During the Release Cycle
sect1.para: This section describes the changes to the website that should occur as the release cycle progresses.

note.para: The files specified throughout this section are relative to the head/ branch of the doc repository in Subversion.

sect2.title: Website Changes Before the Release Cycle Begins
sect2.para: When the release cycle schedule is available, these files need to be updated to enable various different functionalities on the &os; Project website:

row.entry: Change beta.upcoming from IGNORE to INCLUDE
Change % beta.upcoming from IGNORE to INCLUDE
Change beta.testing from IGNORE to INCLUDE
Change % beta.testing from IGNORE to INCLUDE

sect2.title: Website Changes During BETA or RC
sect2.para: When transitioning from PRERELEASE to BETA, these files need to be updated to enable the "Help Test" block on the download page. All files are relative to head/ in the doc repository:

row.entry: Add an entry announcing the BETA
Add the new BETA, RC, or final RELEASE to the template
Add the new BETA, RC, or final RELEASE to the template

sect2.para: Once the &branch.relengx; branch is created, the various release-related documents need to be generated and manually added to the doc/ repository.

Within release/doc, invoke &man.make.1; to generate errata.html, hardware.html, readme.html, and relnotes.html pages, which are then added to doc/head/en_US.ISO8859-1/htdocs/releases/X.YR/, where X.Y represents the major and minor version number of the release.
The fbsd:nokeywords property must be set to on on the newly-added files before the pre-commit hooks will allow them to be added to the repository.

note.para: The relevant release-related documents exist in the doc repository for &os; 12.x and later.

sect2.title: Ports Changes During BETA, RC, and the Final RELEASE
sect2.para: For each build during the release cycle, the MANIFEST files containing the SHA256 of the various distribution sets, such as base.txz, kernel.txz, and so on, are added to the misc/freebsd-release-manifests port. This allows utilities other than &man.bsdinstall.8;, such as ports-mgmt/poudriere, to safely use these distribution sets by providing a mechanism through which the checksums can be verified.
